instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance on early disease detection in crops and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the detection model on early disease detection in crops is the overall accuracy value and Kappa coefficient. The overall accuracy value measures the proportion of correctly classified samples, while the Kappa coefficient measures the agreement between the predicted and actual classifications, taking into account the possibility of agreement by chance. 

The results of the study show that the detection model achieved an overall accuracy value of over 82.35% and a Kappa coefficient of 0.56. This indicates that the model has a relatively high level of accuracy in identifying infected leaves, even when the symptoms of the disease are inconspicuous and difficult to identify using the traditional method.

instruction: Can the combined VIs & NDTIs model used in this study be considered superior to traditional methods for early disease detection in crops using hyperspectral images?
